Trzech KrzyÅ¼y]] 15/17, [[Warsaw]] |employees = |budget = |chief1_name = [[Waldemar Pawlak]] |chief1_position = Minister of Economy |chief2_name = |chief2_position = First Deputy Minister |parent_agency = [[Council of Ministers of the Republic of Poland|Council of Ministers]] |website = [http://www.mg.gov.pl/ www.mg.gov.pl] |footnotes = }} [[Image:Ministry of Economics - Main entrance 02.jpg|250px|thumb|Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Poland]] '''Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Poland''' ({{lang-pl|Ministerstwo Gospodarki}}) is a [[Ministry (collective executive)|ministry]] dealing with economy of [[Republic of Poland]]. Created in 1997 from reforms and mergers of other ministries, it has gone through several name changes and has recently been downsized, with issues related to work being split to [[Ministry of Labour and Social Policy of the Republic of Poland|Ministry of Labour and Social Policy]] and regional issues split to [[Ministry of Regional Development of the Republic of Poland|Ministry of Regional Development]]. In 2007 the bureau of tourism was moved to [[Ministry of Sport of the Republic of Poland|Ministry of Sport]]. The current [[Ministry (collective executive)|minister]] is [[Waldemar Pawlak]]. ==List of ministers== ===Ministers of Economy (1997â2003)=== {| class="wikitable" |- !No. !Name !Term of Offices
